Articles.Content: So I haven't played much since the redesign of the VAB interface. Where did sub-assemblies go? I assumed I had to fully upgrade the VAB, but having done that I still don't see how to create and use sub-assemblies?
There's a blue arrow in the top left that enables "Advanced" mode. Click it. Look for the green spaceship icon in the sidebar that will pop up.
Thank you! No more rebuilding asparagus stages every time ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Sub-assemblies are kind of, almost obsolete, since you can "merge" ships from the load menu now.

> 
> Sub-assemblies are kind of, almost obsolete, since you can "merge" ships from the load menu now.

They're still useful for small parts (like landing gear & pylon assemblies), boosters and launchers, stuff you wouldn't want (or couldn't make due to lack of command pod) a separate save for anyways.

The merge option is kind of buggy for me.

I imported a rover once, and half of it was on the floor of the SPH. When I grabbed it, the two halves, now several meters apart, moved as one, and I could not connect them.

I did not try to replicate this, though, and all other crafts imported with the merge option worked fine... ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif)

> 
> They're still useful for small parts (like landing gear & pylon assemblies), boosters and launchers, stuff you wouldn't want (or couldn't make due to lack of command pod) a separate save for anyways.

Yep, Sub Assemblies don't spam your ship list and can be organized in custom tabs.
